Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Huntley, S.3069, and Assembly Member Wright, A.502, AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of commercial bicyclists”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR  be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Gianaris, S.2513, and Assembly Member Simotas, A.4874, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue use of and convey certain park land”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR  be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Discontinue use of and convey certain park land.  (S.2513/A.4874)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Krueger, S.419-C, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of bicycles for commercial purposes”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Use of bicycles for commercial purposes. (S.419-C)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing for an electronic signature for persons who contest a parking ticket online.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing for an electronic signature for persons who contest a parking ticket online.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to late fees at the parking violations bureau.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Late fees at the parking violations bureau.

Items.Title: The President Pro Tempore will call the meeting to order.
Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) duly called this Recessed Meeting to order.

Items.Title: Roll Call
The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum.
Items.MinutesNote:
The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) duly announced the presence of a quorum.

Editor's Note: The Stated Council Meeting of June 14, 2011 was opened and subsequently recessed on June 14, 2011 before being re-opened on June 15, 2011.  This Recessed Meeting held on June 15, 2011, therefore, is the continuation of the Stated Council Meeting of June 14, 2011.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Army to permanently discontinue the practice of shooting and experimenting on living pigs for the purpose of training soldiers how to treat critical gunshot wounds.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: United States Army to permanently discontinue the practice of shooting and experimenting on living pigs for the purpose of training soldiers how to treat critical gunshot wounds.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to support and pass legislation that would make it unlawful to force feed a bird, by hand or machine, for the purpose of the fatty enlargement of the bird's liver.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Make it unlawful to force feed a bird, by hand or machine, for the purpose of the fatty enlargement of the bird's liver.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R.1397/S.811, the Employment Non-Discrimination Act, which would prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of actual or perceived sexual orientation and gender identity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of actual or perceived sexual orientation and gender identity. (HR 1397/S.811)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend the New York State Public Service Law in order to prevent the over-saturation of communities with electric generating facilities that rely on fossil fuels.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Prevent the over-saturation of communities with electric generating facilities that rely on fossil fuels.

Items.Title: Application no. 20115507 SCQ, a proposed site for a new, approximately 416 seat Primary School Facilities, P.S. 316 (Block 9063, Lot 27 and Block 9064, Lots 31 and 35), Council District No. 32, Borough of Queens. This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant Section 1732 of the New York State Public Authorities Law.
Items.AgendaNote: Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Use
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 416 seat Primary School Facilities, P.S. 316, Queens (20115507 SCQ)

Items.Title: Application no. 20115507 SCQ, a proposed site for a new, approximately 416 seat Primary School Facilities, P.S. 316 (Block 9063, Lot 27 and Block 9064, Lots 31 and 35), Council District No. 32, Borough of Queens. This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant Section 1732 of the New York State Public Authorities Law.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 416 seat Primary School Facilities, P.S. 316, Queens (20115507 SCQ)
